intro: Listrostachys henriquesiana, commonly known as the Henriques' listrostachys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
